info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 16 at 12:22PM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT NORTHUMBERLAND...NORTHEASTERN SNYDER...MONTOUR...SOUTHEASTERN LYCOMING...COLUMBIA AND NORTHEASTERN UNION COUNTIES THROUGH 100 PM EDT... At 1222 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Montoursville to near Milton to near Selinsgrove. Movement was northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation possible. Locations impacted include... Williamsport, Bloomsburg, Berwick, Sunbury, Shamokin, Milton, Mount Carmel, Lewisburg, Selinsgrove, Danville, Montoursville, Northumberland, Kulpmont, Winfield, Muncy, Watsontown, Elysburg, Fairview-Ferndale, Hughesville and Riverside. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 200 PM EDT for central and north central Pennsylvania.
